intro: Senecio scapiodes, commonly known as the slender stem senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf structures. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with upright, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Senecio scapiodes is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
